title: JSParser: replace AndroidJSCore with Rhino
message:
JSParser: replace AndroidJSCore with Rhino

AndroidJSCore is quite a pig because of it's jni libs (adds 40+MB to app)
and I haven't figured out a way to terminate an executing script.

Webview is present already on Android but I haven't been able to get it to
work in a non-UI thread (likely because its used in the UI thread by blockly
and I don't think you can have multiple webviews in differring threads).
Regardless, its a pig performance-wise and a pain to deal with if needing to
run in non UI thread just for javascript parsing.

Rhino seems like a great choice:
 - it's jar is 1.5MB
 - you can easily hook in a debugger to identify what line is being executed
   and to easily terminate a script
 - it can run in any thread
 - it doesn't need any UI

Signed-off-by: Tim Harvey <harvey.tim@gmail.com>

title: Added listen block
message:
Added listen block

The Listen block is a start block that executes in its own thread and
will block until hearing the specified verbal phrase.

This also creates a 'start' block - all blocks not contained within
the start block or listen block are ignored.

I'm using PocketSphinx as I found it much quicker than the native Android
voice recognition API's for simple phrases (although its possible I just
couldn't figure out how to tune them for quick offline response).

Signed-off-by: Tim Harvey <harvey.tim@gmail.com>

define themese per activity to work around this.
